Part I: The Union and its Territory. [1 to 4]
Ar 1: Name and territory of the Union.
Ar 2. Admission or establishment of new states.
Ar 3. Formation of new states and alteration of areas, boundaries or names of existing states.
Ar 4. Law made under Ar. 2 and 3 to provide for the amendment of the First and the Fourth Schedules and supplemental, incidental and consequential matters.
Ar 5. Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution.
Ar 6. Rights of citizenship of certain persons who have migrated to India from Pakistan.
Ar 7. Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan.
Ar 8. Rights of citizenship of certain persons of Indian origin residing outside India.
Ar 9. Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign state not to be citizens.
Ar 10. Continuance of the rights of citizenship.
Ar 11. Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law.
Ar 13. Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of the fundamental rights.
Ar 15. Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth.
Ar 16. Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment.
Ar 19. Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc (Backbone of Our Indian Constitution).
Ar 20. Protection in respect of conviction for offences.
Ar 21. Protection of Life and Personal Liberty.
Ar 21-A. Right to Elementary Education. [86th Amendment, 2002]
Ar 22. Protection against Arrest and Preventive Detention in certain Cases.
Ar 23. Prohibition of Traffic in Human Beings and Forced Labour.
Ar 24. Prohibition of Employment of Children in factories, etc.
Ar 25. Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice and propagation of religion.
Ar 26. Freedom to manage religious affairs.
Ar 27. Freedom as to payment of taxes for promotion of any particular religion.
Ar 28. Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction or religious worship in certain educational institutions.
Ar 29. Protection of interests of minorities.
Ar 30.Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.
Ar 32. Remedies for enforcement of fundamental right including writs. [Soul of Our Indian Constitution]
Ar 33. Power of Parliament to modify the fundamental rights in their application to forces, etc.
Ar 34. Restriction on fundamental rights while martial law is in force in any area.
Ar 35. Legislation to give effect to some of the provisions of fundamental rights.
Part IV: Directive Principles of State Policy. [36 to 51]
Ar 37. Application of the directive principles.
Ar 38. State to secure a social order for the promotion of welfare of the people.
Ar 39. Certain principles of policy to be followed by the State.
Ar 39-A. Equal justice and free legal aid.
Ar 41. Right to work, to education, and to public assistance in certain cases.
Ar 42. Provision for just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief.
Ar 43. Living wage, etc. for workers.
Ar 43-A. Participation of workers in management of industries.
Ar 44. Uniform civil code for the citizens.
Ar 45. Provision for early childhood care and education to children below the age of six years.
Ar 46. Promotion of educational and economic interests of scheduled caste, scheduled tribes and other weaker sections.
Ar 47. Duty of state to raise the level of nutrition and the standard of living and to improve public health.
Ar 48. Organization of agriculture and animal husbandry.
Ar 48-A. Protection and improvement of environment and safeguarding of forests and wild life.
Ar 49. Protection of monuments and places and objects of national importance.
Ar 50. Separation of judiciary from executive.
Ar 51. Promotion of international peace and security.
Part V: The Union Government. [52 to 151]
Ar 53. Executive Power of the Union.
Ar 55. Manner of Election of President.
Ar 56. Term of office of President.
Ar 58. Qualifications for Election as President.
Ar 60. Oath or affirmation by the President.
Ar 61. Procedure for Impeachment of the President.
Ar 62.Time of holding election to fill vacancy in the Office of President and the Term of office of Person elected to fill casual vacancy.
Ar 64. The Vice-President to be ex-officio chairman of the council of states.
Ar 65. The Vice-President to act as President or to discharge his functions during casual vacancies in the office, or during the absence, of President.
Ar 67. Term of office of Vice-President.
Ar 68. Time of holding election to fill vacancy in the office of Vice-President and the term of office of person elected to fill casual vacancy.
Ar 69. Oath or affirmation by the Vice-President.
Ar 70. Discharge of President’s functions in other contingencies.
Ar 71. Matters relating to, or connected with, the election of a President or Vice-President.
Ar 72.Power of President to Grant Pardons, etc., and to suspend, remit or commute sentences in certain cases.
Ar 73. Extent of executive power of the Union.
Ar 74. Council of Ministers to Aid and Advise President.
Ar 75. Other provisions as to ministers.
Ar 77. Conduct of business of the Government of India.
Ar 78. Duties of Prime Minister as respects the furnishing of information to the President, etc.
Ar 80. Composition of the Council of States (Rajya Sabha).
Ar 81. Composition of the House of the People (Lok Sabha).
Ar 83. Duration of Houses of Parliament.
Ar 84. Qualification for membership of Parliament.
Ar 85. Sessions of Parliament, prorogation and dissolution.
Ar 86. Right of President to address and send messages to Houses.
Ar 87. Special address by the President.
Ar 88. Rights of Ministers and Attorney General as respects Houses.
Ar 89. The chairman and deputy chairman of the council of states.
Ar 93. The Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the House of the People.
Ar 100. Voting in Houses, Power of Houses to act notwithstanding vacancies and quorum.
Ar 107. Provisions as to introduction and passing of bills.
Ar 108. Joint sitting of both Houses in certain cases {from Australia}.
Ar 113. Procedure in Parliament with respect to estimates.
Ar 115. Supplementary, additional or excess grants.
Ar 116. Votes on account, votes of credit and exceptional grants.
Ar 117. Special provisions as to Financial Bills.
Ar 120. Language to be used in Parliament.
Ar 121. Restriction on discussion in Parliament.
Ar 122. Courts not to inquire into proceedings of Parliament.
Ar 123. Power of President to promulgate ordinances during recess of Parliament.
Ar 124. Establishment and Constitutional of Supreme Court.
Ar 126. Appointment of acting Chief Justice.
Ar 128. Attendance of Retired Judges at sittings of the Supreme Court.
Ar 129. Supreme Court to be a Court of Record.
Ar 131. Original Jurisdiction of the Supreme Court.

Ar 134. Appellate Jurisdiction of Supreme Court in Regard to Criminal Matter.
Ar 135. Jurisdiction and powers of the federal court under existing law to be exercisable by the Supreme Court.
Ar 136. Special leave to appeal by the Supreme Court.
Ar 137. Review of Judgments or orders by the Supreme Court.
Ar 138. Enlargement of the Jurisdiction of the Supreme Court.
Ar 139. Conferment on the Supreme Court of Powers to issue certain writs.
Ar 140. Ancillary Powers of Supreme Court.
Ar 141. Law declared by Supreme Court to be binding on all courts.
Ar 142. Enforcement to decrees and orders of Supreme Court and orders as to discovery, etc.
Ar 143. Power of President to consult Supreme Court.
Ar 148. Comptroller and Auditor General of India.
Ar 149. Duties and powers of the Comptroller and Auditor General.
Part VI: The State Government. [152 to 237]
Ar 161. Power of governor to grant pardons, etc., and to suspend, remit or commute sentences in certain cases.
Ar 163. Council of ministers to aid and advise governor.
Ar 164. Other provisions as to ministers.
Ar 165. Advocate General for the state.
Ar 168. Constitution of legislatures in states.
Ar 169. Abolition or creation of legislative councils in states.
Ar 170. Composition of the Legislative Assemblies (LA).
Ar 171. Composition of the Legislative Councils (LC).
Ar 178. The Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Assembly (LA).
Ar 182. The Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Legislative Council (LC).
Ar 213. Power of Governor to promulgate ordinances during recess of Legislature.
Ar 215. High courts to be courts of record.
Ar 226. Power of High Courts to issue certain writs.
Part VIII: The Union Territories. [239 to 242]
Part IX-B: The Co-operative Societies. [243-ZH to 243-ZT]
Part X: The Scheduled and Tribunal Areas.[244 to 244-A]
Ar 244. Administration of scheduled areas and tribal areas.
Part XI: Relations between the Union and the States. [245 to 263]
Ar 249. Power of Parliament to legislate with respect to a matter in the State List in the national interest.
Ar 262. Adjudication of disputes relating to waters of inter-state rivers or river valleys.
Ar 263. Provisions with respect to an inter-state council.
Part XII: Finance, Property, Contracts and Suits. [264 to 300-A]
Ar 265. Taxes not to be imposed save by authority of law.
Ar 266. Consolidated Funds and public accounts of India and of the states.
Ar 300-A. Persons not to be deprived of property save by authority of law.
Part XIII: Trade, Commerce and Intercourse within the Territory of India. [301 to 307]
Part XIV: Services under the Union and the States. [308 to 323]
Ar 315. Public Service Commissions for the Union and for the states.
Ar 324. Superintendence, Direction and Control of Elections to be vested in an Election Commission.
Part XVI: Special Provisions relating to Certain Classes. [330 to 342]
Ar 330. Reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the House of the People.
Ar 331. Representation of the Anglo-Indian Community in the House of the People.
Ar 332. Reservation of seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the Legislative Assemblies of the States.
Ar 333. Representation of the Anglo-Indian Community in the Legislative Assemblies of the States.
Ar 338. National Commission for Scheduled Castes.
Ar 338-A. National Commission for Scheduled Tribes.
Ar 338-B. National Commission for Backward Classes.
Ar 339. Control of the Union over the Administration of Scheduled Areas and the welfare of Scheduled Tribes.
Ar 340.Appointment of a Commission to Investigate the conditions of Backward Classes.
Ar 343. Official Language of the Union.
Ar 344. Commission and Committee of the Parliament on Official Language.
Ar 345. Official Language or Languages of a State.
Ar 346. Official Languages for communication between one state and another or between a State and the Union.
Ar 347. Special provision relating to language spoken by a section of the population of a state.
Ar 348. Language to be used in the Supreme Court and in the high court’s and for acts, bills, etc.
Ar 349. Special procedure for enactment of certain laws relating to language.
Ar 350. Language to be used in representations for redress of grievances.
Ar 350-A. Facilities for instruction in mother-tongue at primary stage.
Ar 350-B. Special officer for Linguistic Minorities.
Ar 351. Directive for development of the Hindi Language.
Ar 358. Suspension of provisions of Ar. 19 (A to F) during emergencies.
Ar 359. Suspension of the enforcement of fundamental rights during emergencies.
Ar 356. Provisions in case of failure of Constitutional Machinery in States (President’s Rule) [State Emergency].
Ar 355. Duty of the Union to protect states against external aggression and internal disturbance (President’s Rule).
Ar 365. Effect of failure to comply with, or to give effect to directions given by the Union (President’s Rule).
Ar 361. Protection of president and Governors and Rajpramukhs.
Ar 363. Bar to interference by courts in disputes arising out of certain treaties, agreements, etc.
Ar 364. Special provisions as to major ports and aerodromes.
Ar 365. Effect of failure to comply with, or to give effect to directions given by the Union (president’s rule).
Part XX: Amendment of the Constitution. [368]
Article 368. Power of Parliament to amend the Constitution and procedure there for.
Part XXI: Temporary, Transitional and Special Provisions. [369 to 392]
Ar 369. Temporary power to Parliament to make laws with respect to certain matters in the State List as if they were matters in the Concurrent List.
Ar 370.Temporary provisions with respect to the State of Jammu and Kashmir.

Ar 371-I. Special provision with the respect to the States of Goa.
Ar 371-J. Special provision with the respect to the States of Karnataka.
Ar 392. Power of the President to remove difficulties.
Part XXII: Short title, Commencement, Authoritative Text in Hindi & Repeals. [393 to 395]
Ar 394-A. Authoritative text in the hindi language.
